American TV personality and entrepreneur

Lori Greiner (born December 9, 1969) is an American television personality and entrepreneur.[1] She is an investor on the reality ABC TV series Shark Tank. Greiner has hundreds of inventions and holds 120 patents. She became known as the "Queen of QVC" as a result of her show, Clever & Unique Creations, that premiered on the network in 2000. Greiner is the president and founder of For Your Ease Only, Inc.

Life [ edit ]

Greiner grew up in the Near North Side, Chicago.[2] She majored in communications at Loyola University Chicago and worked for The Chicago Tribune while in college.[3] She was an aspiring playwright and sold jewelry on the side.[4] She is married to Dan Greiner.[3]

Career [ edit ]

Greiner is the president and founder of For Your Ease Only, which launched in 1996.[4][2] The same year, she created and patented a plastic earring organizer; J.C. Penney picked up the product before the holiday season, allowing her to pay off her $300,000 loan in 18 months.[5][6] In addition to jewelry storage, she has patented consumer products in categories such as cosmetic organization, travel, electronics, and household items. Greiner has invented hundreds of products and holds 120 patents.[5]

After her success with J.C. Penney, Greiner expanded her company, with her products appearing on Home Shopping Network[5] and in the retail store Bed Bath & Beyond.[7] In 2000,[4] she began hosting a show on QVC, "Clever & Unique Creations by Lori Greiner".[8] Her many appearances on the network led to her nickname, "The Queen of QVC".[5][9]

In 2012, Greiner joined the U.S. TV series Shark Tank.[9] In 2014, her investment in Scrub Daddy, a company that produces a texture-changing household sponge, was regarded as one of the biggest successes in Shark Tank history.[10][11] Greiner's other early Shark Tank investments include Bantam Bagels (which was fully acquired by T. Marzetti Company in 2018),[12] Squatty Potty,[13] ReadeRest,[9][13] Paint Brush Cover,[13] Hold Your Haunches,[13] Drop Stop,[13] FiberFix,[13] Simply Fit Board,[5] Sleep Styler,[10] and Screenmend.[13] The companies she has invested in have collectively made over $400 million.[14]

Greiner's book, Invent it, Sell it, Bank it! – Make Your Million Dollar Idea into a Reality, was published in March 2014.[2][3]
